meanings.definition: Involving or limited to basic principles.
meanings.sent1: The children were taught a rudimentary lesson on addition.
meanings.sent2: She had only a rudimentary understanding of the subject.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at cooking was so rudimentary, it was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: The rudimentary sketches of the artist captured the essence of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The rudimentary tools in the shed were rusty and worn.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an immature, undeveloped, or basic form.
meanings.sent1: The puppy's rudimentary training was evident in its behavior.
meanings.sent2: Her rudimentary language skills improved with practice.
meanings.sent3: The rudimentary plant struggled to grow in the rocky soil.
meanings.sent4: His rudimentary attempts at poetry showed promise.
meanings.sent5: The rudimentary design of the building lacked sophistication.
